Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Feral \Fe"ral\, a. [L. ferus. See {Fierce}.] (Bot. & Zo["o]l.) Wild; untamed; ferine; not domesticated; -- said of beasts, birds, and plants. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Feral \Fe"ral\, a. [L. feralis, belonging to the dead.] Funereal; deadly; fatal; dangerous. [R.] ``Feral accidents.'' --Burton. [1913 Webster]
feral adj : wild and menacing; "a ferocious dog" [syn: {ferine}, {savage}]
